title: Police: Intruder breaks into Burger King in Little Rock, takes boxes of Whopper hamburger meat
title_page: Police: Intruder breaks into Burger King in Little Rock, takes boxes of Whopper hamburger meat
text:
Authorities are trying to identify an intruder who broke into a Burger King in Little Rock early Tuesday and made off with two boxes of hamburger meat used for the chain's signature burger, the Whopper, according to a police report.
It happened shortly before 1:30 a.m. at the restaurant at 4015 W. Markham St., which is just east of UAMS Medical Center.
According to the report, surveillance video shows the man throw a rock through a door on the west side of the building and then proceed inside directly to the freezer. He then took two boxes of hamburger meat valued at $136 and left the store, police wrote.
The assailant was described as standing about 5 feet 4 inches tall and weighing around 150 pounds. He was wearing a black, red and green hat, a gray sweater, gray pants and brown dress shoes. An employee said the man didn't look familiar.
No suspects were named, and no arrests had been made at the time of the report.
